content.description: This problem has two hard moves, including a couple slopers.  Start on two decent crimps and go up and left.
content.location: SE face of the Library Boulder

content.description: -Same start as King of Cling but go strait up to the highest point on the rock.  Above the undercling jug, there is a really good right hand side pull.
content.protection:
Natural Anchor for TR

Pad for Bouldering
content.location: Same start as King of Cling

content.description:
This tall climb is a right start variation of Flying Solo. Begin with small edges and throw for a bad sloping shelf then work out left to the jug on Flying Solo and finish with that climb.

Named after a nasty digger I took from the very top and landed in the mud and flowing water.
content.location: Start directly right of Flying Solo

content.description: This face climb starts with small holds and seemingly decent feet. That is, until you try and use them. Some of the rock below is a little flakey but the bits you can use are solid.  Don't assume it's over at the lip... insecure friction and bad feet to the top.

content.protection:
Natural anchor for TR

Pad for bouldering
content.location: The main crack climb on the northwest corner of the boulder.

content.description: Start on micro crimpers under the obvious undercling.  Use the undercling to traverse right then continue up the feature and crack.
content.protection:
Natural Anchor for TR

Pad for Bouldering
content.location: North face of the Boulder, under the large undercling

content.description: Common crimpy start then a small left undercling to right crimp high above.
content.location: Look for the small undercling, left of the large undercling.  Start on thin edges directly beneath.

content.description: There is a great start hold about 7 feet off the ground.  Big throw to a good jug then work your way up.  Super fun highball!
content.protection:
Natural Anchor for TR

Pad for Bouldering

content.description: -This is a great climb if you like crimpers.
content.location: -On the main face, it's the first climb to the right of the down climb.  Its on the shorter portion of the boulder.

content.description: This is a sit start on a jug and a rail. The climb continues up and to the left, into the crack.  This is a highball problem but the second half is easy.
content.protection:
Natural Anchor for TR

Pad for Bouldering
content.location: If youre facing Nelson, go downhill to the right only ten feet away.
